package-manager.name: depot
package-manager.title: BIND Domain Name Server
package-manager.description: Berkeley Internet Name Domain (BIND) is an implementation of the Domain Name System (DNS) protocols and provides an openly redistributable reference implementation of the major components of the Domain Name System, including a Domain Name System server (named).

item.para: CVE-2012-1033 (http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2012-1033): The resolver in ISC BIND overwrites cached server names and TTL values in NS records during the processing of a response to an A record query, which allows remote attackers to trigger continued resolvability of revoked domain names via a "ghost domain names" attack.

CVE-2012-1667 (http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2012-1667): ISC BIND does not properly handle resource records with a zero-length RDATA section, which allows remote DNS servers to cause a denial of service (daemon crash or data corruption) or obtain sensitive information from process memory via a crafted record.
Update source from 9.8.1 to 9.8.1-P1 to address the following security vulnerability:

CVE-2011-4313 (http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2011-4313): BIND incorrectly handled certain specially crafted packets allowing a remote attacker could to use this flaw to cause a crash, resulting in a denial of service.
